title: Bug 4329 - No results when searching via Package view selection and dialog (1GLDN1X)
description: When searching via the Package view selection and dialog, no results are returned. The package view initializes the Search dialog with the fully qualified name, which causes the issue. It should instead try to get the Java element and if that fails, display the element name rather than the fully qualified name.
OB: When searching for declarations, the Search dialog initialized with the fully qualified name does not return any results.
EB: When searching for declarations, the Search dialog should first try to get the Java element. If that fails, it should display the element name instead of the fully qualified name.
SR:
1. Open the Package view in the Java application.
2. Select a package from the view.
3. Open the Search dialog.
4. Verify that the Search dialog is initialized with the fully qualified name.
5. Enter a search term for declarations.
6. Execute the search.
7. Verify that no results are returned.
8. Right-click on the package in the Package view.
9. Use the context menu to search for declarations.
10. Verify that the search via the context menu returns results.
